history.content:
I don't think you need 16B material for 70 (I took 70 without 16B). I heard the 16B labs this semester don't require you to build anything so you should be fine with labs. I took 16B last semester and I thought it was very well run. I think both are great options, maybe think about what you would take the semester after if you were to choose either course?

------

You definitely do not need EECS16B material for 70 this semester. The most you will need is linear algebra (steady states) for the end of the class when markov chains are covered. However, 16A covers enough so you will be comfortable will the material. I think 7b and 70 is a good combo. If you want to hold off on taking 16B because labs are online, I'd definitely stick with your plan and wait until classes are in person.

Hi, this semester I am taking Physics 7b and either CS70 or EECS16b. I was initially going to take eecs16b rather than 70 because I heard it is kinda a pre req to prepare you for 70, but with all the labs being via zoom, I am worried about doing 16b. Does anyone have any advice for which would be better to take?
history.subject: CS70 or EECS16b
